conversationHistory.botResponse:
Hello! I can help you with dal storage.

•   Store dal in an airtight container in a cool, dry place. This can extend its shelf life to about 1 year.

•   For longer storage, consider storing it in the refrigerator. This can keep it fresh for over a year.

•   If you have cooked dal, refrigerate it promptly in an airtight container. It should be consumed within 3-4 days.

•   To prevent waste, use leftover dal to make dal puri (approx. 40 BDT).

Reducing food waste helps lower greenhouse gas emissions from landfills.

Next step: Ensure your dal is stored properly to maximize its shelf life.

Hello! I can help you find affordable vegetables rich in vitamins.

• Focus on green leafy vegetables like spinach and red or orange vegetables.

• Spinach (approximately 20 BDT per bundle) is an excellent source of vitamin A and C.

• Carrots (around 30 BDT per kg) provide beta-carotene, which your body converts into vitamin A.

Vitamins are essential for boosting your immune system and overall health.

Next step: Include spinach or carrots in your next meal to boost your vitamin intake!

Hello! I can help you create a 500 BDT meal plan, considering your moderate budget.

• Main meal: Chicken and vegetable curry with rice (approximately 200 BDT). This provides protein and essential vitamins.

• Cheaper alternative: Egg curry with lentils and rice (about 150 BDT). This still offers a good balance of protein and carbohydrates.

Shopping tip: Buy seasonal vegetables from local markets to save money.
